To Amend Section 41-21-77, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Provisions Pertaining To Commitment To A Facility To The Preceding Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 41-21-79, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Prohibit The Charging Of Certain Costs To The Affiant; To Create New Section 41-21-104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide For The Continuing Jurisdiction Of The Court Over The Respondent After Release From Mental Health Treatment; To Amend Section 41-32-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Provisions Concerning The Contents Of The Affidavit To The Preceding Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 41-32-5, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify The Defendant's Right To Legal Counsel; To Amend Section 41-32-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Provisions Concerning Respondents Likely To Flee Or Cause Harm To The Preceding Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 41-32-11, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform The Provisions Dealing With Assistance Of Sheriffs To The Preceding Provisions Of This Act; To Amend Section 41-30-27, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform Provisions Relating To Emergency Involuntary Commitments For Alcoholics And Addicts To The Preceding Provisions Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1546.title: Controlled substances; revise Schedules I, II, and V.
1546.description: An Act To Amend Section 41-29-113, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Schedule I Of The Controlled Substances Act To Include Certain Synthetic Cannabinoids, Fentanyls And Fentanyl-like Substances That Have No Accepted Medical Use; To Amend Section 41-29-115, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Amend Schedule Ii To Exclude Naldemedine; To Amend Section 41-29-121, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise Schedule V To Include A Cannabinoid That Has Been Approved As A Legend Drug By The Federal Food And Drug Administration; To Create A Task Force To Study The Cultivation Of Hemp And Make Recommendations; And For Related Purposes.

1547.title: Daylight saving time; observe year-round if the federal law is amended to allow it.
1547.description: An Act To Provide That Daylight Saving Time Shall Be The Year-round Standard Time Of The State Of Mississippi If Federal Law Is Amended To Authorize States To Observe Daylight Saving Time Year-round And All Contiguous States Observe The Same; And For Related Purposes.

1548.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Jackson with sidewalk improvements.
1548.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Construction Of Sidewalks And Related Improvements Along A Portion Of Raymond Road Between Cedarwood Drive And Forest Hill Road In The City Of Jackson; And For Related Purposes.

1549.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for Capitol Complex Improvement District and City of Jackson projects.
1549.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Improvement Projects Within The Capitol Complex Improvement District; To Assist The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Making Repairs, Upgrades And Improvements To The City's Water And Sewer Systems And Related Infrastructure, And To Assist The Jackson Public School District In Paying Costs Associated With Construction, Repair, Renovation, Replacement And Improvement Of District School Buildings And Facilities And Related Infrastructure; To Provide That The Principal Of And Interest On The Bonds Will Be Paid Primarily From Monies In The Capitol Complex Improvement District Project Fund; To Amend Section 29-5-215, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1550.title: Operation of vessel in reckless or negligent manner; include wakeboarding restrictions.
1550.description: An Act To Amend Section 59-21-83, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Penalties Applicable To Reckless Or Negligent Operation Of A Vessel On The Waterways Of This State Shall Include Creating Excessive Waking Which Endangers Persons Or Properties In Congested Areas Or Pier/dock Areas; And For Related Purposes.

1551.title: Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol; increase salaries of sworn officers by $7,500.00.
1551.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-1-12, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Increase By $7.500.00 The Salaries Of All Sworn Officers Of The Mississippi Highway Safety Patrol, Including Service In The Driver's License Division And The Sworn Officers Of The Mississippi Bureau Of Narcotics; And For Related Purposes.

1552.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of coins, gold, silver and other metals.
1552.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Coins, Currency, Legal Tender, Medallions, Numismatic Coins, And Platinum, Gold Or Silver Bullion; And For Related Purposes.

1553.title: Appropriation; DFA to pay salaries of federally funded state agency employees affected by federal government shutdown.
1553.description: An Act Making Appropriations From The Working Cash-stabilization Reserve Fund To The Department Of Finance And Administration To Provide State Funds To State Agencies To Replace Federal Funds That Those Agencies Would Have Otherwise Received For Paying The Salaries Of Employees Of Those Agencies Whose Salaries Are Fully Or Partially Paid With Federal Funds, But Which Federal Funds Are Unavailable Because Of The Partial Shutdown Of The Federal Government; To Provide That Each State Agency That Receives Funds From The Department Under The Provisions Of This Act Shall Repay To The Department All Of The Federal Funds That They Receive After The Partial Shutdown Of The Federal Government Has Been Fully Resolved That Are Retroactive Payments Of The Federal Funds That The Agency Would Have Otherwise Received For Paying The Salaries Of Employees Of Those Agencies Whose Salaries Are Fully Or Partially Paid With Federal Funds During The Period Of The Partial Shutdown Of The Federal Government; To Provide That Upon Receipt Of Repayments Of Those Funds From State Agencies, The Department Shall Deposit Those Funds Into The Working Cash-stabilization Reserve Fund.

1554.title: City of Natchez; authorize to donate/convey the Natchez Intermodal Transportation Center and certain historic properties to United States.
1554.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Natchez, Mississippi, To Donate And Convey The Natchez Intermodal Transportation Center And Certain Historic Properties Of The City Of Natchez To The United States Of America; And For Related Purposes.

1555.title: Income tax; exempt income of certain physicians practicing in critical physician shortage areas.
1555.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Critical Physician Shortage Incentive Act Of 2019"; To Provide That The Gross Income Of Newly Licensed Physicians Practicing Medicine In Critical Physician Shortage Areas Shall Not Include Any Income Derived From Providing Medical Services In Critical Physician Shortage Areas; To Provide That The Exemption From Gross Income Authorized By This Act May Be Utilized By The Qualifying Physician For Ten Consecutive Years If The Physician Practices In Such An Area For That Period Of Time; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1556.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Holly Springs with construction of a wellness and aquatics.
1556.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Holly Springs, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A Wellness And Aquatics Center And Related Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1557.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Holly Springs restoration of former Holly Springs Water and Light Plant building.
1557.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Holly Springs, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Restoration Of The Former Holly Springs Water And Light Plant Building For The Purpose Of Using It As A Welcome Center And/or Museum And Related Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1558.title: Reverse auctions in public purchases; make applicable only to agencies.
1558.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Reverse Auctions Shall Be The Primary Method Of Receiving Bids During The Bidding Process For Agencies; And For Related Purposes.

1560.title: Reverse auction; prohibit use for certain term contract.
1560.description: An Act To Amend Section 31-7-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That Reverse Auctions Shall Not Be Used For Certain Term Contracts; And For Related Purposes.

1561.title: "Forming Open and Robust University Minds (FORUM) Act"; establish.
1561.description: An Act To Establish The "forming Open And Robust University Minds (forum) Act," As It Relates To Freedom Of Speech On The Campuses Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; To Prohibit A State Institution Of Higher Learning From Denying A Religious, Political Or Ideological Student Organization A Benefit Or Privilege Available To Another Student Organization, Or Otherwise Discriminate Against Such An Organization, Based On The Expression Of The Organization; To Require State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Develop And Make Available Materials Explaining The Policy For Campus Staff And Students; To Require State Institutions Of Higher Learning To Submit A Yearly Report Detailing The Course Of Action Implemented To Comply With The Policy; To Prescribe A One-year Statute Of Limitations For Actions Brought Under This Act; To Waive The State's Immunity From Liability Under The Eleventh Amendment Of The United States Constitution; And For Related Purposes.

1562.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for construction of the Center for STEM Education and Advancement.
1562.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Construction Of The Center For Science, Technology, Engineering And Math (stem) Education And Advancement At The Mississippi Children's Museum In Jackson, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1563.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Lauderdale County with improvements at industrial park.
1563.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Lauderdale County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Construction, Development And Upgrades Of And Improvements To Facilities, Property And Infrastructure Within The County's Industrial Park; And For Related Purposes.

1564.title: City of Starkville; authorize levying of additional tourism tax on hotels, motels and restaurants.
1564.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Starkville, Mississippi, To Levy An Additional Sales Tax Of Not More Than 1% On The Gross Sales Of Hotel And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Construct, Finance, Operate, Equip, Lease And Maintain New Sports Tournament And Recreational Facilities And Improve Existing Sports And Recreational Facilities; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1565.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Greenville with extension of Colorado Street.
1565.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Greenville, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Extension Of Colorado Street In The City Of Greenville; And For Related Purposes.

1566.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Holly Springs with improvements to Mississippi Highway 178.
1566.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Holly Springs, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Construction, Reconstruction And Repair Of And Upgrades And Improvements To Mississippi Highway 178 And Related Infrastructure In The City Of Holly Springs; And For Related Purposes.

1567.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for the Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund.
1567.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $7,940,000.00 To Provide Matching Funds For Federal Funds For The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund; To Amend Section 49-17-85, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize Interest And Investment Earnings On Money In The Water Pollution Control Revolving Fund To Be Utilized To Pay Debt Service On The Bonds Authorized To Be Issued By This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1569.title: Appropriation; City of Jackson for repairs needed to address flooding of Eubanks Creek.
1569.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The City Of Jackson

1570.title: Appropriation; MDEQ to allocate funds to Hinds County Board of Supervisors for waste reduction program.
1570.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality For The Purpose Of Allocating Funds To The Hinds County Board Of Supervisors For A Solid Waste Reduction Program For The Fiscal Year 2020.

1571.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for capital improvements at the Mississippi State Fire Academy.
1571.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Capital Improvements At The Mississippi State Fire Academy; And For Related Purposes.

1573.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for certain improvements at LeFleur's Bluff State Park.
1573.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Construction And Development Of And Upgrades And Improvements To Property, Roadways, Infrastructure, Facilities And Structures At Lefleur's Bluff State Park, In Jackson, Mississippi, For The Purpose Of Enhancing And Developing The Entrance To The Mississippi Children's Museum And The Mississippi Museum Of Natural Science, And Areas And Amenities Related To The Museums; And For Related Purposes.

1574.title: Fee-in-lieu of ad valorem taxes; revise investments required by qualified business under the Mississippi Health Care Zone Act.
1574.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-31-104, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Revise The Amount Of Investment Required For Projects By Qualified Businesses Under The Mississippi Health Care Industry Zone Act In Order For Such Projects To Be Eligible To Be Granted A Fee-in-lieu Of Ad Valorem Taxes; And For Related Purposes.

1575.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of lottery tickets.
1575.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Lottery Tickets Sold In Accordance With The Alyce G. Clarke Mississippi Lottery Law; And For Related Purposes.

1576.title: Appropriation; Hinds County Board of Supervisors for Hinds County Circuit Drug Court for treatments for opioid addiction.
1576.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Hinds County Board Of Supervisors For The Purpose Of Allocating Funds To The Hinds County Circuit Drug Court For Additional Treatment Options For Those Addicted To Opioids For The Fiscal Year 2020.

1577.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of tangible personal property to Mississippi's Toughest Kids foundation for construction of Camp Kamassa.
1577.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property To The Mississippi's Toughest Kids Foundation For Use Solely In The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of Buildings And Related Facilities And Infrastructure At Camp Kamassa In Copiah County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1578.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for construction of a multipurpose building at the Greenville Higher Education Center/Mississippi Delta Community College.
1578.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying The Costs Associated With Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Multipurpose Building And Related Facilities To House Academic Shops And Classrooms At The Greenville Higher Education Center/mississippi Delta Community College; And For Related Purposes.

1579.title: Department of Defense Contractors; authorize certain incentives for.
1579.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers That Are Awarded Contracts With The United States Department Of Defense; To Provide For The Amount Of The Tax Credit; To Provide That Any Tax Credit Claimed Under This Act But Not Used In Any Taxable Year May Be Carried Forward For Five Consecutive Years From The Close Of The Tax Year In Which The Credit Was Earned; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Establish A Program To Make Grants To Business Enterprises For The Purpose Of Assisting The Enterprises In Constructing Facilities And Making Upgrades And Improvements To Facilities That Are Necessary For The Performance Of, Or To Facilitate The Performance Of, Contracts Awarded To Such Enterprises With The United States Department Of Defense And In Order For The Business Enterprises To Become More Competitive Or Remain Competitive In Bidding For The Award Of Contracts With The United States Department Of Defense; To Authorize The Issuance Of $5,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Such Grant Program; And For Related Purposes.

1580.title: Firearms; clarify that courtroom includes a judge's chamber, witness room and jury room.
1580.description: An Act To Amend Section 97-37-7, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That Courtroom Includes A Judge's Chamber, Witness Room And Jury Room, For Purposes Of Concealed Carry; And For Related Purposes.

1581.title: Firearms in medical facilities; restrict concealed carry unless instructor-certified.
1581.description: An Act To Amend Section 45-9-101, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Restrict Concealed Carry At Medical Facilities Unless An Instructor-certified Permittee; And For Related Purposes.

1582.title: Income tax; provide for method of apportioning income for certain medical laboratory service facilities.
1582.description: An Act To Provide For The Method Of Apportionment Of Income For Income Tax Purposes Of A Major Medical Laboratory Service Facility; To Amend Section 27-7-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1583.title: Historic property income tax credit; increase amount of credits that may be awarded and revise certain other provisions.
1583.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-22.31, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes An Income Tax Credit For Costs And Expenses Incurred For The Rehabilitation Of Certain Historic Structures; To Remove The Provision That Excludes Single-family Dwellings From The Definition Of The Term "eligible Property"; To Remove The Provision That Authorizes The Taxpayer To Elect To Receive A 75% Rebate On The Amount Of The Credit In Excess Of $250,000.00 In Lieu Of The Ten-year Carryforward So As To Allow The Taxpayer To Elect To Receive A Rebate On 75% Of The Total Amount Of The Credit In Lieu Of The Ten-year Carryforward; To Increase By $60,000,000.00 The Maximum Aggregate Amount Of Tax Credits That May Be Awarded Under This Section And To Remove The Limitation On The Amount Of Credits That May Be Awarded In Any One State Fiscal Year; To Grant Priority For The Tax Credit To Taxpayers Who Were Issued A Certificate Evidencing The Eligible Credit Prior To July 1, 2019; To Provide That The Tax Credit Shall Apply To Taxpayers Who Have Been Issued A Certificate Evidencing The Eligible Credit Before December 31, 2029, Or Who, Before December 31, 2029, Have Received A Determination In Writing From The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History That The Rehabilitation Is Consistent With The Historic Character Of The Property And That The Property Meets The United States Secretary Of The Interior's Standards For Rehabilitation And Who Are Issued A Certificate Evidencing The Eligible Credit On Or After December 31, 2029; And For Related Purposes.

1584.title: DeSoto County; authorize to contribute funds, in-kind donations and support to economic development council.
1584.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County, Mississippi, To Donate Funds, Make In-kind Donations And Provide Support To The Desoto County Economic Development Council, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1585.title: Income tax; provide a credit for taxpayers who claim a federal earned income tax credit.
1585.description: An Act To Provide A State Income Tax Credit For Taxpayers Claiming The Federal Earned Income Tax Credit; To Provide The Amount Of The Credit; To Provide That If The Amount Of Credit Claimed By A Taxpayer Exceeds The Amount Of Income Tax Imposed Upon The Taxpayer For The Taxable Year, Then The Taxpayer Shall Receive A Refund From The Department Of Revenue For The Amount Of Such Excess; And For Related Purposes.

1586.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Jackson with improvements to Belhaven Heights Park and Jaycee Park.
1586.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Improvements To Belhaven Heights Park And Jaycee Park; And For Related Purposes.

1587.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Town of Port Gibson with improvements to Grand Gulf Road.
1587.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Port Gibson, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repairs, Repaving, Paving And Other Improvements To Grand Gulf Road In The Town Of Port Gibson; And For Related Purposes.

1588.title: Ad valorem tax; exempt motorcycles while in the hands of dealers as merchandise.
1588.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-51-41, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Ad Valorem Taxation Motorcycles While In The Hands Of Bona Fide Dealers As Merchandise; And For Related Purposes.

1589.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of tangible personal property and services to Mississippi's Toughest Kids Foundation for construction of Camp Kamassa.

1591.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Repair And Renovation Of And Improvements To The Kirk Fordice Equine Center And The Mississippi Coliseum; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For Repair And Renovation Of And Improvements To The Mississippi Agriculture And Forestry Museum; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Pay Costs Associated With The Acquisition Of Certain Real Property Located In The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, As Authorized By Chapter 405, Laws Of 2018; And For Related Purposes.

1610.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Flowood, Mississippi, To Levy Sales Tax In The Amount Of 3% Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Room Rentals Of Hotel And Motel Rooms In The City; To Provide That The Tax Levy Shall Be Used For The Purpose Of Paying Any Debt Incurred In Connection With The Acquisition, Construction, Reconstruction, Expanding, Improving, Furnishing, Equipping And Repairing Of A Conference Center And Related And Ancillary Facilities; To Require That An Election Be Held On The Question Of The Imposition Of Such Tax; And For Related Purposes.

1612.title: Children's Promise Act; create.
1612.description: An Act To Create The Children's Promise Act; To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Voluntary Cash Contributions By Business Enterprises To Eligible Charitable Organizations; To Limit The Amount Of The Credit; To Provide That Unused Portions Of A Credit May Be Carried Forward For Five Consecutive Years From The Close Of The Tax Year In Which The Credit Was Earned; To Provide That Contributions For Which Credits Are Claimed Under This Act May Not Be Used As Deductions For State Tax Purposes; To Provide The Criteria That An Eligible Charitable Organization Must Meet In Order For A Contribution To The Organization To Qualify For The Credit Authorized By This Act; To Amend Section 27-7-22.39, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes Income Tax Credits For Voluntary Cash Contributions To Qualifying Charitable Organizations And Qualifying Foster Care Charitable Organizations, To Revise The Definitions Of The Terms "qualifying Charitable Organization", "qualifying Foster Care Charitable Organization" And "services" For The Purposes Of Such Section Of Law, To Revise Certain Provisions Regarding Certifications That Charitable Organizations Must File With The Department Of Revenue; To Increase The Maximum Aggregate Amount Of The Income Tax Credits That May Be Awarded In A Calendar Year; To Extend The Date Of The Repealer On Such Section; To Amend Section 27-7-22.32, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Authorizes An Income Tax Credit For Expenses Incurred For The Adoption Of A Child, To Extend The Reverter On The Provision Of Law That Provides That The Maximum Amount Of The Tax Credit Cannot Exceed $5,000.00 For A Child And The Provision That Authorizes An Income Tax Credit For Children Adopted Through The Mississippi Department Of Child Protection Services; And For Related Purposes.

1613.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist with dredging at Hancock County Port and Harbor.

1669.title: Mississippi Critical Physician Shortage Act of 2019; create.
1669.description: An Act To Create The "mississippi Critical Physician Shortage Incentive Act Of 2019"; To Provide That The Gross Income Of Newly Licensed Physicians, Physician Assistants And Advanced Practice Registered Nurses Practicing In Critical Physician Shortage Areas Shall Not Include Any Income Derived From Providing Services In Critical Physician Shortage Areas; To Provide That The Exemption From Gross Income Authorized By This Act May Be Utilized By The Qualifying Physician, Physician Assistant Or Advanced Practice Registered Nurse For Ten Consecutive Years If The Physician, Physician Assistant Or Advanced Practice Registered Nurse Practices In Such An Area For That Period Of Time; To Amend Section 27-7-15, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1682.title: City of Bay St. Louis; authorize levying of tax on bars and restaurants to promote tourism, parks and recreation.
1682.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Bay St. Louis, Mississippi, To Impose A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Bars And Restaurants In An Amount Not To Exceed 2% For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Promotion Of Tourism, Parks And Recreation Within The City; To Provide For An Election On Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1683.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for City of Raymond Police Department building.
1683.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Raymond, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Expansion Of And Additions, Upgrades And Improvements To The City's Police Department Building And Related Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1685.title: Income tax; authorize credit for certain motion picture production expenditures.
1685.description: An Act To Authorize An Income Tax Credit For Certain Expenditures Made For The Production Of Motion Pictures In This State; To Define Certain Terms For The Purposes Of This Act; To Provide Eligibility Criteria For The Tax Credit; To Provide For The Amount Of The Tax Credit; To Limit The Amount Of Tax Credits That May Be Granted In A Fiscal Year; And For Related Purposes.

1686.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for repair and renovation of former Southside High School in Heidelberg.
1686.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Southside High School Alumni Association In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Restoration Of The Former Southside High School In Heidelberg, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1687.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist National Oak Park Alumni Association with improvements to its Alumni House in Laurel.
1687.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The National Oak Park Alumni Association In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Restoration Of Its Alumni House In Laurel, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1688.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for improvements to Lynn Meadows Discovery Center in Gulfport.
1688.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Expansion Of And Additions And Improvements To The Lynn Meadows Discovery Center In Gulfport, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1689.title: Income tax; provide for method of apportioning income for certain freight forwarding businesses.
1689.description: An Act To Provide For The Method Of Apportionment Of Income For Income Tax Purposes Of Certain Qualified Freight Forwarders That Are Affiliates Of Airlines; To Amend Section 27-7-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1690.title: City of Union; authorize expansion of water services provided by.
1690.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Union, Mississippi, To Expand Its Water Distribution System Within A Certain Distance Outside The Corporate Limits Of The City Of Union; And For Related Purposes.

1691.title: Suffrage; restore to Anthony Leroy Wallace of Harrison County.
1691.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Anthony Leroy Wallace Of Harrison County, Mississippi.

1692.title: Suffrage; restore to Shannon B. Oatis of Harrison County.
1692.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Shannon B. Oatis Of Harrison County, Mississippi.

1693.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for improvements at John C. Robinson Mississippi Aviation Museum in Gulfport.
1693.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The John C. Robinson "brown Condor" Association In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Expansion Of And Additions And Improvements To A Building Leased From The City Of Gulfport, Mississippi, For The John C. Robinson Mississippi Aviation Museum And For Design, Acquisition, Storage And Installation Of Exhibits At The Museum; And For Related Purposes.

1694.title: Bonds; authorize issuance for repair and renovation of Margaret Martin Performing Art Center in Natchez.
1694.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Repairing, Renovating And Refurbishing The Margaret Martin Performing Arts Center In Natchez, Mississippi, Which Is Designated A Mississippi Landmark By The Mississippi Department Of Archives And History; And For Related Purposes.

1695.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Natchez with preservation of Natchez Bluff retaining wall.
1695.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Natchez, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Cutting And Removal Of Trees And Other Vegetation In Order To Allow And Aid Inspections Necessary To Preserve Structural Integrity And Stabilization Of The Natchez Bluff Retaining Wall And Related Structures In The City Of Natchez; And For Related Purposes.

1696.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Natchez in constructing a Civil Rights Memorial.
1696.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Purpose Of Assisting The City Of Natchez, Mississippi, In Constructing A Monument Commemorating The Civil Rights Movement Of The 1960s; And For Related Purposes.

1697.title: Appropriation; Supreme Court for funding position of Jurist in Residence.
1697.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi State Supreme Court For The Purpose Of Funding The Position Of Jurist In Residence For The Fiscal Year 2020.

1698.title: Income tax; provide for method of apportioning income of certain medical laboratory service businesses.
1698.description: An Act To Provide For The Method Of Apportionment Of Income For Income Tax Purposes Of A Major Medical Laboratory Service Business; To Amend Section 27-7-23, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.

1699.title: Bonds; increase amount authorized for the Hinds County Development Project Loan Fund and allow use for construction of a parking garage.
1699.description: An Act To Amend Section 10, Chapter 567, Laws Of 2013, To Increase By $10,000,000.00 The Amount Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Hinds County Development Project Loan Fund And Authorize Money In The Fund To Be Utilized As A Loan To Hinds County, Mississippi, To Assist In Funding The Construction Of A Parking Garage Associated With A Certain Hotel Construction Project; And For Related Purposes.

1700.title: City of Waveland; authorize to offer leasing of Waveland Business Center that binds successor governing authorities of the city.
1700.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Waveland, Mississippi, To Offer The Public A Twelve Year Lease Of The Waveland Business Center; And For Related Purposes.

1701.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist Perry County with certain road and bridge improvements.
1701.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Perry County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Certain Road And Bridge Improvements In The County; And For Related Purposes.

1702.title: Appropriation; State Public Defender for contracting with attorneys to represent indigent parents in certain cases.
1702.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Office Of State Public Defender For The Purpose Of Contracting With Trained And Certified Attorneys To Represent Indigent Parents Or Guardians In Abuse, Neglect Or Termination Of Parental Rights Proceedings For The Fiscal Year 2020.

1703.title: Income tax; revise certain provisions to address investment in federally designated qualified opportunity zones.
1703.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-7-9, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Provide That To The Extent That Gain Is Not Recognized Or Is Deferred For The Sale Or Exchange Of Property Or For Investment In Qualified Opportunity Zone Property Through A Qualified Opportunity Fund Under Federal Law, There Shall Be No Gain Recognized Or Gain Shall Be Deferred For Such Sale Or Exchange Of Property Or Investment For The Purposes Of The State Income Tax Law, Provided That The Property Is In Or The Investment Is In Qualified Opportunity Zone Property In A Qualified Opportunity Zone Located In This State; To Provide That To The Extent That There Is An Increase In Basis For Such Property Or Investment Under Federal Law, There Shall Be An Increase In Basis For The Property Or Investment For The Purposes Of The State Income Tax Law; And For Related Purposes.

1704.title: City of Jackson; authorize to create land banks to address blighted properties more efficiently within the city.
1704.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Facilitate The Conversion Of Vacant, Abandoned Or Land Struck Off To The State Property Within The City Into Productive Use By Utilizing The Land Bank Process; To Authorize The Creation Of The City Of Jackson Land Bank Authority; To Provide The Powers And Duties Of The Board Of Directors Of The Land Bank Authority; To Authorize The Authority To Acquire And Dispose Of Property; To Provide An Expedited Procedure To Confirm And Quiet Title To Property Acquired By The Authority; To Authorize The Authority Created Under This Act To Enter Into Intergovernmental Agreements For Certain Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1705.title: City of Jackson; extend repeal date on convention and visitors bureau and reconstitute membership of bureau.
1705.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 909, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, As Last Amended By Chapter 954, Local And Private Laws Of 2018 To Extend Until July 1, 2022, The Repeal Date On The Provisions Of Law That Create The Jackson Convention And Visitors Bureau And Imposes A Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants, Hotels And Motels For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Bureau; To Reconstitute The Membership Of The Jackson Convention And Visitors Bureau; To Provide That The General Manager Of The Capital City Convention Center Shall Serve As An Ex Officio, Nonvoting Member Of The Bureau; To Amend Chapter 1019, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, To Reconstitute The Membership Of The Capital City Convention Center Commission; To Provide That The Chief Executive Officer Of The Jackson Convention And Visitors Bureau Shall Serve As An Ex Officio Nonvoting Member Of The Commission; And For Related Purposes.

1706.title: Appropriation; IHL for Alcorn State University for renovating the Whitney Health and P.E. Complex or constructing a new academic convocation center.
1706.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Purpose Of Providing Funding To Alcorn State University For The Design And Planning Of Renovating The Davey L. Whitney Health And Physical Education Complex Or Constructing A New Academic Convocation Center Into The Whitney Complex For The Fiscal Year 2020.

1707.title: Appropriation; IHL for Alcorn State University Agricultural Programs for renovation and repair of aquaculture facility.
1707.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Purpose Of Providing Funding To The Alcorn State University Agricultural Programs For The Renovation And Repair Of The Aquaculture Facility On The Lorman Campus For The Fiscal Year 2020.

1708.title: Appropriation; IHL for Alcorn State University for making modifications to buildings to comply with Americans with Disabilities Act.
1708.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Purpose Of Providing Funding To Alcorn State University For Making Modifications To Several Selected High Priority Buildings To Comply With The Americans With Disabilities Act For The Fiscal Year 2020.

1709.title: Appropriation; IHL for Alcorn State University for design and planning of construction of new student union complex.
1709.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Purpose Of Providing Funding To Alcorn State University For The Design And Planning Of The Construction Of A New Student Union Complex On Its Main Campuses In Lorman For The Fiscal Year 2020.

1710.title: Appropriation; IHL for Alcorn State University for improving campus safety and security.
1710.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning For The Purpose Of Providing Funding To Alcorn State University For Improving Campus Safety And Security For The Fiscal Year 2020.

1711.title: City of Pascagoula; extend repeal date on tax on hotels, motels and B&Bs to promote tourism.
1711.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 1005, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, As Last Amended By Chapter 912, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law Authorizing The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel, Motel And Bed-and-breakfast Room Rentals In The City; And For Related Purposes.

1712.title: Suffrage; restore to Dexter Lee Foster of Lee County.
1712.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Dexter L. Foster Of Harrison County, Mississippi.

1713.title: City of Hattiesburg; increase maximum amount of additional annual payments to fire/police retirees.
1713.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 907, Local And Private Laws Of 1990, As Last Amended By Chapter 927, Local And Private Laws Of 2009, To Increase The Maximum Amount Of The Additional Annual Payments Made To Retired Members And Beneficiaries Of The Hattiesburg Police And Fire Disability And Relief Fund From Thirty Percent To Thirty-two Percent Of The Annual Retirement Or Disability Allowance; And For Related Purposes.

1714.title: City of Canton; authorize to enter into long-term agreements with Madison county Economic Development Authority concerning industrial park.
1714.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Canton, Mississippi, And The Members Of The Board Of Directors Of The Madison County Economic Development Authority To Enter Into Certain Agreements To Grant To Qualifying New Or Expanding Enterprises Legally Permitted Exemptions From, Or A Fee-in-lieu Of, City Ad Valorem Taxes With Respect To Certain Real Property Located Within Two Miles Of The Municipal Boundary Of The City, Together With Any Improvements And Personal Property Located Thereon, In Connection With The Development By The Madison County Economic Development Authority Of Such Real Property For Economic Development Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

1715.title: Tallahatchie County; authorize to offer Medicare eligible employees supplemental compensation, insurance and/or benefits if employees secure Medicare coverage.
1715.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tallahatchie County, Mississippi, To Offer Any Medicare Eligible County Employee Certain Benefits If The Employee Secures Medicare Coverage In Lieu Of Participating In Any County Medical Or Health Insurance Program; And For Related Purposes.

1716.title: Walnut Grove; authorize correctional facility to house prisoners who have been classified to any custody level.
1716.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 991, Local And Private Laws Of 1998, As Amended By Chapter 915, Local And Private Laws Of 2013, To Authorize The Walnut Grove Correctional Authority To Provide Housing For Offenders Classified To Any Custody Level; And For Related Purposes.

1717.title: City of Waveland; authorize leasing of Waveland Business Center that binds successor governing authorities.
1717.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Waveland, Mississippi, To Offer The Public A Twelve Year Lease Of The Waveland Business Center That Shall Bind Successor Governing Authorities Of The City; And For Related Purposes.

1718.title: Warren County; authorize contributions to local nonprofit economic development organizations & authorize provision of certain matching funds.
1718.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Execute Contracts And Agreements And Contribute Funds To Local Economic Development Organizations; To Authorize The Board To Provide Funding To Match Any Program Or Grant Funding For Economic Development Purposes, If Such Program Or Grant Is Administered By The State Of Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

1719.title: Warren County; authorize contributions to various organizations.
1719.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Central Mississippi Prevention Services, Inc.; Triumph Ministries, Inc.; Vicksburg Family Development Services, Inc.; Warren, Washington, Issaquena, Sharkey Community Action Agency, Inc.; Women's Restoration Shelter Of Mountain Faith Ministries; And We Care Communities, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

1720.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize to enter into lease agreements for water park improvements and to acquire such improved property through rental contracts.
1720.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Enter Into Certain Lease Agreements For The Purpose Of Making Waterfront Area Park Improvements And Related Amenities Utilizing Certain Provisions Of State Law That Pertain To The Acquisition Of Public Buildings, Facilities And Equipment Through Rental Contracts; And For Related Purposes.

1721.title: Suffrage; restore to Jimmie Joseph Webb, Jr., of Harrison County.
1721.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Jimmie Joseph Webb, Jr., Of Harrison County, Mississippi.

1722.title: City of Gautier; authorize 1% assessment on retail sales at Singing River Mall site for improvements to site.
1722.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Gautier, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Assessment On Tenants, Owners Or Occupiers Of The Singing River Mall Site In The Amount Of 1% Of The Total Retail Sales Generated By The Operations Of Each Tenant, Owner Or Occupier For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Acquisition, Construction, Reconstruction, Expansion, Improvement, Furnishing, Equipping, Maintaining And Repairing Of Properties, Infrastructure And Improvements Related To The Singing River Mall Site; And For Related Purposes.

1723.title: City of Gautier; authorize sale or 75-year lease of Singing River Mall for less than fair market value to attract retail.
1723.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Gautier, Mississippi, To Enter Into Long-term Agreements Related To The Financing And Development Of The Singing River Mall Site And Related Ancillary Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

1724.title: Suffrage; restore to Miko Butler of Pike County.
1724.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Miko Butler Of Pike County, Mississippi.

1725.title: City of Columbia; authorize a tax on hotels, motels and restaurants to promote parks and recreation.
1725.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Columbia, Mississippi, To Levy A Sales Tax Of Not More Than 3% Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Promote Local Parks And Recreation As Well As Economic Development; To Require An Election Be Held On Whether Such Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1726.title: Marshall County; certain road contacts within Chickasaw Trails Industrial Park may extend beyond of term of board of supervisors.
1726.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Enter Into Certain Contracts For The Construction, Reconstruction And Maintenance Of Public Roads And Bridges Within The Chickasaw Trails Industrial Park That Extend Beyond 30 Days From The Termination And End Of The Term Of Office Of Such Board; And For Related Purposes.

1727.title: Suffrage; restore to Christopher Mathis of Tippah County.
1727.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Chris Mathis Of Tippah County, Mississippi.

1728.title: Suffrage; restore to Billy Gene Barnes of Tippah County.
1728.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Billy Gene Barnes Of Tippah County, Mississippi.

1729.title: Lauderdale County; authorize to fund Chaplaincy Program of the detention facility from revenue of inmate phone service.
1729.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lauderdale County, Mississippi, To Fund The Lauderdale County Detention Facility's Good News Jail And Prison Ministry Chaplain And Chaplaincy Program From Nontax Revenue Generated By The Inmate Telephone Service; And For Related Purposes.

1730.title: City of Okolona; authorize to use electric power delivery system to provide broadband service to certain counties.
1730.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Okolona, Mississippi, To Utilize Its Electric Power Delivery System In Chickasaw, Monroe, Lee And Clay Counties, Mississippi, To Provide Broadband Service To Customers; And For Related Purposes.

1731.title: Town of Seminary; authorize use of golf carts on certain public roads and streets within the town.
1731.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The Town Of Seminary, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The Town; To Require Individuals Operating A Golf Cart To Have A Valid Driver's License Or Temporary Driver's Permit; And For Related Purposes.

1732.title: Issaquena County; authorize to contract for private operation of county regional facility to house minimum or medium security offenders.
1732.description: An Act To Authorize The Issaquena County Board Of Supervisors To Contract With A Private Entity For The Construction, Lease, Acquisition, Improvement, Operation Or Management Of A Private County Owned Jail Facility That Is Used As A Regional Correctional Facility To House State Inmates; To Provide That The Board May Contract With Such Private Entity To House Inmates For The Department Of Corrections, The United States, Any State Or States That Have Minimum Or Medium Security Offenders Who Are In The Custody Of Those Jurisdictions; And For Related Purposes.

1733.title: Greene County; authorize to construct or acquire a county jail anywhere in county after voter approval.
1733.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Greene County, Mississippi, To Construct Or Acquire A County Jail Anywhere Within The County; To Require An Election Be Held On The Construction Or Acquisition Of Such County Jail; And For Related Purposes.

1734.title: City of Diamondhead; authorize city to designate streets upon which golf carts and low-speed vehicles may be operated.
1734.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 938, Local And Private Laws Of 2012, To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Diamondhead, Mississippi, To Designate By Ordinance The Roads And Streets Upon Which Low-speed Vehicles And Golf Carts May Be Operated; And For Related Purposes.

1735.title: Marshall County; authorize contribution to ARISE2Read literacy program.
1735.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Arise2read Literacy Program; And For Related Purposes.

1736.title: Marshall County; authorize contribution to Bishop Houck New Hope Village.
1736.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Bishop Houck New Hope Village; And For Related Purposes.

1737.title: Tallahatchie County; authorize contribution to City of Charleston for certain maintenance and improvements to city's armory building and grounds.
1737.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tallahatchie County, Mississippi, To Make A Contribution To The City Of Charleston, Mississippi, For The Maintenance, Improvement And Repair Or For The Provision Of Utilities As Well As Internet Services For City Property That Is Known As The Charleston Armory Building And Grounds; And For Related Purposes.

1738.title: DeSoto County; provide certain annexation procedure for any city within the county seeking to annex a portion of county.
1738.description: An Act To Provide An Alternative Mechanism For Annexation For Any City Within Desoto County, Mississippi, That Seeks To Annex Any Portion Of The County; To Provide Certain Definitions; To Require That The Governing Authorities Of A City Pass An Ordinance Defining Which Unincorporated Territory Of The County That Is Subject To Annexation; To Provide That Before Annexation May Occur, A City Must Provide Certain Notice Of The Annexation; To Provide An Indirect Referendum For Those Who Are Subject To The Annexation; To Provide An Appeals Process For An Annexation; And For Related Purposes.

1739.title: City of Moss Point; authorize use of golf carts and/or low-speed vehicles on certain public roads and streets.
1739.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Moss Point, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts And Low-speed Vehicles On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City; To Require Individuals Operating A Golf Cart Or Low-speed Vehicle To Have A Valid Driver's License Or Temporary Driver's Permit; And For Related Purposes.

1740.title: City of Columbus; authorize issuance of bonds to secure broadband infrastructure.
1740.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Columbus, Mississippi, To Issue Revenue Bonds For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Pay The Costs Of Developing, Constructing, Owning, Improving, Maintaining And Operating Broadband Infrastructure; And For Related Purposes.

1741.title: City of Waynesboro; authorize governing authorities to impose a tax on hotels, motels, bed-and-breakfasts, bars and restaurants.
1741.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Waynesboro, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From The Sales Of Bars And Restaurants As Well As Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From The Sales Of Hotels, Motels And Bed-and-breakfast Room Rentals; To Provide That Such Special Tax Shall Be In An Amount Not To Exceed 1% For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Promotion Of Tourism, Parks And Recreation Within The City; To Provide For An Election On Whether Such Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1742.title: Lafayette County; authorize to create the Lafayette County Utility Authority.
1742.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lafayette County, Mississippi, To Create And Establish A Public Body Corporate And Politic Constituting A Political Subdivision Of The State Of Mississippi To Be Known As The Lafayette County Utility Authority For The Purpose Of Providing Storm Water, Water And Wastewater Systems For The Anticipated Growth Within Lafayette County And Economic Development Activities Within Lafayette County; To Provide For A Board Of Directors To Exercise The Powers Of The Authority; To Provide For The Membership Of The Board Of Directors; To Provide For The Powers, Duties And Responsibilities Of The Authority; To Authorize Public Agencies To Enter Into Contracts With The Authority For Certain Purposes; To Provide That Any Municipality, Public Agency, District, Public Utility Or Other Person Authorized By Law To Provide Water, Sewer And Wastewater Services To Transfer Its Powers, Duties And Responsibilities To The Authority; To Authorize The Authority To Borrow Money And To Issue Revenue Bonds And Interim Notes In Such Principal Amounts As The Authority May Determine To Be Necessary To Provide Sufficient Funds For Achieving One Or More Of The Purposes Of This Act; And For Related Purposes.

1743.title: City of Diamondhead; authorize to levy a parks and recreation special parcel assessment if certain conditions occur.
1743.description: An Act To Provide That If The Diamondhead Country Club And Property Owners Association, Inc., Authorizes The Transfer Of All Or A Portion Of Its Assets And Amenities To The City Of Diamondhead, Mississippi, For Operation, Maintenance And Improvement, The City Of Diamondhead Is Authorized To Accept Such Assets And Amenities; To Provide That Upon Acceptance Of Such Assets And Amenities And After An Election At Which A Majority Votes In Favor Of The Assessment, The City Is Authorized And Empowered, In Its Discretion, To Levy An Annual Assessment In The Form Of A Flat Rate Fee On Every Parcel Of Property In The City In An Amount Reasonably Determined By The Governing Authorities Of The City To Be Necessary To Operate, Maintain And Improve The Recreation Assets And Amenities Of The City; To Exempt Certain Property From The Assessment; To Provide That The Assessment Shall Be Collected By The Hancock County Tax Collector In The Same Manner That Ad Valorem Taxes Are Collected And Paid; And For Related Purposes.

1744.title: City of Gulfport; authorize tax on hotels, motels and restaurants to promote tourism, parks and recreation.
1744.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Gulfport, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Of The Sales Of Restaurants In An Amount Not To Exceed 3% For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Promotion Of Tourism, Parks And Recreation Within The City; To Provide For An Election On The Question Of Whether The Tax May Be Levied; And For Related Purposes.

1745.title: Suffrage; restore to Donna Kaye Taylor of Panola County.
1745.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Donna Kaye Taylor Of Panola County, Mississippi.

1746.title: Suffrage; restore to Phillip L. Sterling of Lincoln County.
1746.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Phillip L. Sterling Of Lincoln County, Mississippi.

1747.title: Suffrage; restore to Stanley Love of Tunica County.
1747.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Stanley Love Of Tunica County, Mississippi.

1748.title: Suffrage; restore to Dorothy Jones of Amite County.
1748.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Dorothy Jones Of Amite County, Mississippi.

1749.title: City of Magnolia and City of McComb; authorize agreements for cooperative wastewater transportation, treatment and disposal.
1749.description: An Act To Authorize The City Of Magnolia, Mississippi, And The City Of Mccomb, Mississippi, To Enter Into A Cooperative Agreement For A Term Of Not More Than 35 Years For The Establishment And Maintenance Of A System For The Collection, Transportation, Treatment And Disposal Of Sewage And Wastewater; And For Related Purposes.

1750.title: Suffrage; restore to Charles Frank Holloway, Jr. of Copiah County.
1750.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Charles Frank Holloway, Jr., Of Copiah County, Mississippi.

1751.title: Suffrage; restore to Patrick J. Fick.
1751.description: An Act To Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Patrick Joseph Fick Of Harrison County, Mississippi.

1752.title: Mr. O.D. Jackson; recognize and commend distinguished military and community service of.
1752.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Distinguished Military And Community Service Of Mr. O.d. Jackson, From Neshoba County, Mississippi, Who Served In Combat Operations In World War Ii.

1753.title: Patrolman James Kevin White; commend life and legacy of service of upon his passing.
1753.description: A Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Commending The Life And Legacy Of Patrolman James Kevin White, Of The Brookhaven Police Department, Who Was Lost In The Line Of Duty On Saturday, September 29, 2018, And Expressing Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1754.title: Corporal Walter Zachery "Zach" Moak; commend life and legacy of service upon his passing.
1754.description: A Resolution Remembering The Gallant Service And Commending The Life And Legacy Of Corporal Walter Zachery "zach" Moak, Of The Brookhaven Police Department, Who Was Lost In The Line Of Duty On Saturday, September 29, 2018, And Expressing Sympathy To His Family And Friends Upon His Passing.

1755.title: President Trump; urge to agree that the press is not a threat to America, but one of the nation's greatest protectors of freedom.
1755.description: A Resolution Urging President Trump To Agree That The Press Is Not A Threat To America, But One Of This Nation's Greatest Protectors Of Freedom.

1756.title: President Trump; urge to end the tariff war because it hurts Mississippi farmers.
1756.description: A Resolution Urging President Trump To End The Tariff War That Is Harming The Livelihoods Of Mississippi Farmers.

1757.title: Lineman Appreciation Month; designate April 2019 as.
1757.description: A Resolution Declaring April 2019 As "lineman Appreciation Month" In Recognition Of The Outstanding Service Of Electrical Linemen In The State Of Mississippi And In Remembrance Of The Life And Legacy Of Mr. Jamie Neal Guin.

1758.title: House Rules; amend to require a racial impact statement for all legislation to be attached to each bill.
1758.description: A Resolution To Create New House Rule No. 104c To Provide A Procedure For Issuance Of Racial And Ethnic Impact Statements That Examine How Proposed Legislation Will Affect Certain Populations.

1759.title: Emmett Till murder; issue apology for state's role in killers' acquittals that were based on a lie.
1759.description: A Resolution Apologizing For The Role Mississippi Played In The Murder Of Emmett Till And The Acquittal Of His Killers, Roy Bryant And J.w. Milam, Which Was Based Upon An Unsubstantiated Lie Told By Carolyn Bryant.

1760.title: Lake Hico; urge Entergy Mississippi to assist residents with returning to a public park.
1760.description: A Resolution Urging Entergy Mississippi, Inc., To Assist The Residents Around Lake Hico With Restoring Lake Hico To A Public Park For The Betterment Of The Community, The City Of Jackson And The State Of Mississippi.

1761.title: Mississippi trade relations with India; honor such and welcome Consul General Kulkarni.
1761.description: A Resolution Honoring The Trade Relations Between India And Mississippi, Expressing Our Appreciation For The Successful Relationship And Welcoming Consul General Dr. Swati Vijay Kulkarni To Our Great State.

1871.description: A Resolution Mourning The Loss And Commemorating The Life And Legacy Of Mr. Charles Edward Graham.

1872.title: Kim Rodgers; commend for his invaluable service to the Mississippi Independent Pharmacies Association.
1872.description: A Resolution Commending Kim Rodgers Of Petal, Mississippi, For His Invaluable Service To The Mississippi Independent Pharmacies Association Over The Years.

1873.title: Dr. Beverly Wade Hogan; commend service upon her retirement as President of Tougaloo College.
1873.description: A Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership And Service Of President Beverly Wade Hogan Upon The Occasion Of Her Retirement As The President Of Tougaloo College.

1874.title: St. Aloysius High School Boys Soccer Team; commend upon winning first MAIS Class AAA State Soccer Championships.
1874.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The St. Aloysius High School Flashes Boys Soccer Team And Coaches Scott Mathis, Pat Chambers And Thad Wade For Winning Their First Ever Mississippi Association Of Independent Schools Class Aaa State Soccer Championship.

1875.title: Senator Thomas A. "Tommy" Gollott; commend distinguished legislative career and public service upon the occasion of his retirement.
1875.description: A Resolution Commending The Esteemed And Laudable Legislative Career And Public Service Of The Most Honorable And Distinguished Gentleman From Harrison, The "ironman," "dean" And "godfather" Of The Mississippi Legislature, Senator Thomas Arlin "tommy" Gollott, Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement From The Mississippi Senate.

1876.title: Coach James Crain; commend for outstanding basketball coaching career.
1876.description: A Resolution Commending Simpson Academy Boys Basketball Head Coach James Crain For His Outstanding, Distinguished And Dedicated Coaching Career.

1877.title: Simpson Academy Girls Basketball Team; commend upon winning 2019 MAIS Class AAAA Division II State Championship.
1877.description: A Resolution Commending The 2018-2019 Simpson Academy Lady Cougars Basketball Team Upon Winning The 2019 Mais Class Aaaa Division Ii State Basketball Championship.

1878.title: Dr. Eddie A. Holloway; commend upon his retirement as Dean of Students for the University of Southern Mississippi.
1878.description: A Resolution Commending Dr. Eddie A. Holloway For His Outstanding Service And Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement As Dean Of Students For The University Of Southern Mississippi.

1879.title: Coach Cameron Achord; commend for being named assistant coordinator for special teams for the New England Patriots.
1879.description: A Resolution Commending Coach Cameron Achord Of Brookhaven For Being Named Assistant Special Teams Coordinator For The New England Patriots.

1880.title: Presbyterian Christian School Boys Cross Country Team; commend for winning 2018 MAIS AAAA State Championship.
1880.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Presbyterian Christian School Bobcats Boys Cross Country Team And Coach Wayne Williams For Winning The 2018 Mississippi Association Of Independent Schools Aaaa State Championship.

1881.title: Donna Dill; commend upon her retirement as Tishomingo County Circuit Clerk.
1881.description: A Resolution Recognizing And Commending Mrs. Donna Dill For Her Outstanding Service As Tishomingo County Circuit Clerk Upon Her Retirement.

1882.title: Silver Bullet club; commend for its many impressive community contributions in the Tallahatchie County community.
1882.description: A Resolution Commending The Members Of The Silver Bullet Club Of Tallahatchie County, Mississippi, For Its Impressive Contributions To The Youth Within Its Community.

1883.title: Presbyterian Christian High School Boys Track Team; commend for winning 2018 MAIS Class 4A State Championship.
1883.description: A Resolution Commending And Congratulating The 2018 Presbyterian Christian High School Boys Track Team And Head Coach Joey Hawkins For Winning The Mississippi Association Of Independent Schools Class 4a State Championship.

1884.title: Honorable Adrienne Wooten; commend distinguished legislative career and congratulate upon election to the bench.
1884.description: A Resolution Commending The Distinguished And Laudable Legislative Career Of Former Representative, The Honorable Adrienne Wooten And Congratulating Her Upon Being Elected To The Bench As Circuit Court Judge Of District 7, Place 1, Hinds County, Mississippi.

1885.title: Representative Willie James Perkins, Sr.; commend distinguished legislative career and congratulate on election as chancellor.
1885.description: A Resolution Commending The Distinguished And Laudable Legislative Career Of Representative Willie James Perkins, Sr., And Congratulating Him Upon Being Elected Chancellor For Subdistrict 7-2 Of The Seventh Chancery Court Judicial District.

1886.title: Representative Preston E. Sullivan; commend for outstanding legislative career upon his retirement.
1886.description: A Resolution Commending The Most Honorable And Distinguished Gentleman From Chickasaw, Representative Preston E. Sullivan, For His Esteemed And Laudable Legislative Career And Public Service Upon The Occasion Of His Retirement From The Mississippi House Of Representatives.

1887.title: Representative Margaret Rogers; commend distinguished legislative career and public service of upon the occasion of her retirement.
1887.description: A Resolution Commending The Esteemed And Laudable Legislative Career And Public Service Of The Most Honorable, Distinguished Lady From Union, Representative Margaret Ellis Rogers.

1888.title: Joint Session; call to hear the State of the State address of Governor Phil Bryant.
1888.description: A Concurrent Resolution Providing For A Joint Session Of The Mississippi Legislature To Hear The State Of The State Address Of Governor Phil Bryant.

1889.title: Resident Trump; urge to cancel military parade and use monies to help the veterans.
1889.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging President Trump To Permanently Cancel His Military Parade And Use The Money To Help Our Military Veterans And Their Families.

1890.title: Fannie Lou Hamer; request the Joint Committee on the Library of Congress to approve the replacement of the statue of James Zachariah George.
1890.description: A Concurrent Resolution Formally Requesting The Joint Committee On The Library Of Congress To Approve The Replacement Of The Statue Of James Zachariah George That Is Displayed In Statuary Hall In The United States Capitol With A Statue Of Civil Rights Icon Fannie Lou Hamer.

1891.title: Kaylee Foster; commend for her many accomplishments.
1891.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Kaylee Foster Upon Becoming The First Female To Win Homecoming Queen And Also Kick The Game-winning Extra Point For The Ocean Springs High School Greyhounds Football Team.

1892.title: Constitution; ratify the Equal Rights Amendment of the U.S. Constitution.
1892.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Ratify The Equal Rights Amendment Of The United States Constitution.

1893.title: Constitution; amend to require the Legislature to review administrative rules that would significantly impact the state budget.
1893.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Require The Legislature To Review Each Administrative Rule Promulgated By A State Agency Which Would Affect The State Budget By Ten Percent Or More; To Provide That Any Such Rule Would Become Effective At The End Of The Next Legislative Session Unless The Legislature Disapproves Of The Rule By A Resolution Adopted By Both Houses; And For Related Purposes.

1894.title: Simpson Academy Lady Cougars Fast-pitch Softball Team; commend upon winning back-to-back MAIS AAAA Division II State Championships.
1894.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Simpson Academy Lady Cougars Fast-pitch Softball Team And Head Coach Adam Evans Upon Winning Back-to-back Mississippi Association Of Independent Schools Aaaa Division Ii Fast-pitch Softball State Championships.

1895.title: Reverend Dr. Hickman Johnson; commend upon occasion of 50th anniversary as pastor of Farish Street Baptist Church.
1895.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Reverend Dr. Hickman M. Johnson On The Occasion Of His 50th Anniversary As Pastor Of Farish Street Baptist Church.

1896.title: Mary Childs; commend upon becoming 130th Chairman and first female chairman of the Mississippi Bankers Association.
1896.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating Mrs. Mary Martin Childs Of The Peoples Bank Of Ripley Upon Being Named The 130th Chairman Of The Mississippi Bankers Association And The First Woman To Serve In The Role.

1897.title: International Women's Day; acknowledge and observe on March 8, 2019.
1897.description: A Concurrent Resolution Acknowledging And Observing March 8, 2019, As "international Women's Day" And Encouraging The Citizens Of Mississippi To Commemorate Its Observance On March 8, 2019.

1898.title: MS Celebrating Women in Public Office Day; declare March 19, 2019 as.
1898.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating March 19, 2019, As Mississippi Celebrating Women In Public Office Day.

1899.title: Women's Equality Day in Mississippi; designate August 26, 2019, as.
1899.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating August 26, 2019, As Women's Equality Day In Mississippi And Recognizing The Important Milestone Of Women's Suffrage.

1900.title: Dr. David Marion; commend for being named Grand Basileus of Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc.
1900.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending Dr. David Marion For Being Named Grand Basileus Of Omega Psi Phi Fraternity, Inc.

1901.title: Donate Life Month; designate April 2019 as.
1901.description: A Concurrent Resolution Designating April 2019 As "donate Life Month" In Mississippi.

1902.title: Constitution; amend to require the members of the State School Board of Education to be elected.
1902.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 203, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That Beginning In 2021, The Members Of The State Board Of Education Shall No Longer Be Appointed And The Board Shall Be Comprised Of One Member Elected From Each Congressional District Of The State And One Member Elected From The State At Large; To Provide That The Terms Of The Elected Board Members Are For Four Years; To Provide That A Board Member May Be Removed By A Three-fifths Vote Of The Mississippi House Of Representatives; And For Related Purposes.

1903.title: Calvin Huey; commend the many accomplishments of.
1903.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Life And Legacy Of Mr. Calvin Huey, The First African American To Play Football For The Naval Academy.

1904.title: Joint Rules; amend to limit introduction of general bills requiring majority vote to sessions in even-numbered years.
1904.description: A Concurrent Resolution To Amend The Joint Rules Of The Mississippi Senate And House Of Representatives By Creating New Joint Rule 18a To Limit The Introduction Of General Bills Requiring A Majority Vote For Passage To Regular Legislative Sessions Occurring In Even-numbered Years.

1905.title: Bobby Mooney; commend distinguished public service of.
1905.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending The Distinguished Career And Meritorious Leadership And Service That Mr. Bobby Mooney Has Provided For 40 Years And Continues To Provide As The Alderman At Large For Collins, Mississippi.

1906.title: Neshoba Central High School Slow-pitch Softball Team; commend for wining 2018 MHSAA Division III State Championship.
1906.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Neshoba Central High School Lady Rockets Slow-pitch Softball Team For Winning The 2018 Mississippi High School Activities Association Division Iii Slow-pitch Softball State Championship.

1907.title: Sergeant Trey Troney; commend heroism of.
1907.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending The Heroism Of Sergeant Trey Troney And The Remarkable Benevolence That He Showed To Mr. Jeff Udger.

1908.title: Constitution; amend to abolish existing State Department of Education and transfer powers and duties to Division of Public Education in Office of the Governor.
1908.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing Amendments To Section 203 And Section 202, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Abolish The Existing State Department Of Education And Transfer The Powers And Duties To The Office Of The Governor; To Provide That The Former State Department Of Education Shall Be Known As The Division Of Public Education In The Office Of The Governor; And For Related Purposes.

1909.title: Constitution; prohibit the state or any agency or political subdivision from donating public funds to any person or entity for any purpose.
1909.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 66, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Prohibit The State Or Any Agency Or Political Subdivision Of The State Or Any Other Unit Of Government From Donating Or Contributing Any Public Funds To Any Person, Organization Or Other Entity For Any Purpose.

1910.title: Constitution; amend to reduce assessment ratio for motor vehicles.
1910.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 112, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Reduce The Assessment Ratio For Motor Vehicles; And For Related Purposes.

1911.title: Daylight savings time; urge Congress to enact legislation to allow states to observe year-round.
1911.description: A Concurrent Resolution Urging The Congress Of The United States To Enact Legislation Allowing Individual States To Establish Daylight Saving Time As The Standard Time In Their Respective States Throughout The Calendar Year.

1912.title: Dr. Hilliard L. Lackey III; commend for service as mentor to Jackson State University students.
1912.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending Dr. Hilliard L. Lackey Iii For His Outstanding Service As A Mentor To The Students Of Jackson State University.

1913.title: Christian Allen; commend for being named MHSAA Class 4A Mr. Football 2018.
1913.description: A Concurrent Resolution Recognizing And Commending Christian Allen For Being Named Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 4a Mr. Football 2018 And For His Outstanding Accomplishments As Starting Quarterback For The Mendenhall High School Football Team.

1914.title: Constitution; amend to reconstitute the Board of Trustees of State Institutions of Higher Learning.
1914.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 213a, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Reconstitute The Board Of Trustees Of State Institutions Of Higher Learning; And For Related Purposes.

1915.title: Florence Middle School Cheerleaders; commend upon winning state championship.
1915.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Florence Middle School Eagles Cheerleading Team For Winning The 2018 Mississippi High School Activities Association Medium Junior High Division.

1916.title: Constitution; amend to authorize the Legislature to grant certain authority for metropolitan government creation.
1916.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 To Require The Legislature To Enact General Laws, And To Authorize The Enactment Of Local And Private Laws, Which Authorize And Prescribe The Manner And Procedure By Which Counties And Cities May Merge And Consolidate To Form A Metropolitan Government; And For Related Purposes.

1917.title: Constitution; amend to elect Governor by majority of popular vote, with no electoral vote requirement.
1917.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing To Amend The Mississippi Constitution Of 1890 By Amending Section 140 And Repealing Sections 141 And 142 To Provide That The Person Receiving The Majority Of Votes For The Office Of Governor At The General Election Shall Be Declared Elected; To Provide That If No Person Receives A Majority Of The Votes, Then A Runoff Election Shall Be Held Between The Two Persons Receiving The Highest Number Of Votes; To Abolish The Requirement That The Governor Be Elected By Vote Of The House Of Representatives If No Person Receives Both A Majority Of The Popular Vote And A Majority Of The Electoral Votes; And For Related Purposes.

1918.title: Constitution; amend to restore voting rights after certain time to qualified electors who have committed a felony.
1918.description: A Concurrent Resolution Proposing An Amendment To Section 241, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, To Provide That A Person Who Is Otherwise A Qualified Elector And Has Been Convicted Of A Felony Shall Have His Or Her Right To Vote Suspended Upon Conviction And Shall Not Have His Or Her Right To Vote Restored Until Three Years After He Or She Has Satisfied All Of The Sentencing Requirements Of The Conviction; And Proposing The Repeal Of Section 253, Mississippi Constitution Of 1890, Which Provides That The Legislature May, By A Two-thirds Vote Of Both Houses, Of All Members Elected, Restore The Right Of Suffrage To Any Person Disqualified By Reason Of Crime.

1919.title: Water Valley High School Blue Devils Football Team; commend upon winning MHSAA 3A State Championship.
1919.description: A Concurrent Resolution Commending And Congratulating The Water Valley High School Blue Devils Football Team And Head Coach Brad Embry For Winning The Mississippi High School Activities Association Class 3a State Football Championship.

1920.title: Constitution; amend to restore voting rights to qualified electors who have committed a felony once sentencing requirements are met.
