3055.title: Bonds; authorize for various purposes.
3055.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds For The Purpose Of Making Capital Improvements For State Institutions Of Higher Learning, State Agencies And Community And Junior Colleges; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Gulfport, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Construction Of The Mississippi Aquarium In The City Of Gulfport; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair, Renovation And Other Improvements To Buildings And Related Facilities In The City Of Batesville, Mississippi, To House The Concourse Workforce Training Center; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Hancock County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Dredging At Port Bienville In Hancock County Or Improvements To Buccaneer State Park; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Claiborne County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repairs And Preventative Maintenance To Grand Gulf Road; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist The City Of Biloxi In Paying The Costs Associated With Improvements To Division Street And Forrest Avenue Related To The Construction Of A New Main Entry Gate To Keesler Air Force Base; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair, Rehabilitation, And Related Construction Activities For The Mississippi Center For Innovation And Technology In The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Lee County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Designing, Constructing, Developing, Equipping And Implementing A Regional Wastewater Treatment Center And Related Facilities, Systems And Infrastructure; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Scenic Rivers Development Alliance In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Rehabilitation Of And Upgrades And Improvements To Various Parks, Lakes And Facilities And Property In Amite County, Franklin County, Walthall County And Wilkinson County; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Veterans Affairs Board To Use As Matching Funds For A Federal Project To Build A New Veterans' Nursing Home In Harrison County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Construction Of A Workforce Center, To Be Called The Northwest Mississippi Industry 4.0 Workforce Training Center, On The Northwest Community College Desoto Center Campus In Southaven, Mississippi; To Amend Sections 6 Through 20, Chapter 521, Laws Of 1995, As Last Amended By Section 35, Chapter 452, Laws Of 2018, To Increase From $32,843,000.00 To $33,843,000.00 The Amount Of State General Obligation Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Local Governments And Rural Water Systems Improvements Revolving Loan Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Scenic Rivers Development Alliance In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Rehabilitation Of And Upgrades And Improvements To Various Parks, Lakes And Facilities And Property In Amite County, Franklin County, Pike County, Walthall County And Wilkinson County; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Scenic Rivers Development Alliance In Paying Costs Associated With The Acquisition Of Approximately 150 Acres Of Land From The United States Department Of Agriculture In Franklin County, Mississippi, Construction And Development Of A Conference Center And Related Buildings And Facilities On Such Land And Related Infrastructure Improvements; To Authorize The Issuance Of General Obligation Bonds In The Amount Of $3,000,000.00 To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Watershed Repair And Rehabilitation Cost-share Program; To Amend Section 51-37-3, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Conform To The Provisions Of This Act; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Mississippi Community Heritage Preservation Grant Fund; To Amend Section 39-5-145, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; To Increase The Amount Of Funds That May Be Disbursed As Grant Funds To The City Of Columbus, Mississippi, To Assist In Paying The Costs Associated With Repair, Renovation And Restoration Of The Columbus City Hall Building And Related Facilities; To Provide That A Portion Of The Funds Shall Be Disbursed As Grant Funds To Tate County, Mississippi, To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Improvements To The Tate County Courthouse; To Authorize The Issuance Of $5,000,000.00 Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Small Municipalities And Limited Population Counties Fund; To Amend Section 57-1-18, Mississippi Code Of 1972, (as Amended By Section 2 Of Senate Bill No. 2272, 2019 Regular Session), To Provide That A Portion Of The Proceeds Of Certain Bonds May Be Used By The Mississippi Development Authority To Reimburse Certain Costs Related To The Administration Of The Fund; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist Rankin County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Related To The Extension Of Gunter Road; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Laurel, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Associated With The Improvement Of Drainage And The Correction Of Other Water Retention Problems; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Perry County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Making Improvements To Leonard Clark Road; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Assist Adams County, Mississippi, In Paying The Costs Related To The Completion Of The Belwood Levee; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Sumrall, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Constructing, Furnishing And Equipping Recreational Facilities; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Newton, Mississippi, In The Repair, Renovation, Furnishing And Equipping Of Newton City Hall; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Copiah County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Maintenance And Renovation Of And Other Improvements To The Copiah County Airport; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Caledonia, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Infrastructure And Lighting Improvements To Caledonia Park; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Noxapater, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repairs, Resurfacing And Making Other Improvements To Streets In The Town Of Noxapater; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of French Camp, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repairs And Other Improvements To The Town's Sewer System And Related Infrastructure; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Maintenance And Other Improvements To A Bus Route At Or Near West Marion High School In Marion County, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Noxubee County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repair And Replacement Of Boilers At The Noxubee County Courthouse; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Hinds County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Construction, Repair, Upgrades And Other Improvements To, Along And/or Near Jesse Harper Road And Improvements To, Along And/or Near The Interstate 20 North Frontage Road For The Purpose Of Reducing The Risk And Occurrence Of Flooding; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Choctaw County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Maintenance And Other Improvements To Sherwood East - Ocl Road In Choctaw County; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Eupora, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Construction And Development Of An Access Road And Related Infrastructure In The Town Of Eupora; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Long Beach, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Maintenance And Other Improvements To Long Beach Cemetery; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Ackerman, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repairs, Resurfacing And Making Other Improvements To Streets In The Town Of Ackerman; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Monroe County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Reconstruction, Maintenance And Other Improvements To Mcalister Road In Monroe County; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist To Pay Costs Associated With The Repair And Replacement Of Flooring In The Mississippi Children's Museum In Jackson, Mississippi; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Harrison County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of An Expansion Of The Harrison County Law Enforcement Training Academy; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Itawamba County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repair Of A Bridge On Boat Ramp Road In Itawamba County; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Wesson, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repair And Renovation Of The Town's Police Station And Related Facilities; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To North Delta Planning And Development District, Inc., To Use For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Upgrades Of And Improvements To Sewer Infrastructure In The Darling Community In Quitman County; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Kosciusko, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repaving The City's Courthouse Square And Connecting Roads; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Bruce, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Improvements To The City's Water System And Related Infrastructure; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Pearl River Valley Water Supply District In Paying Costs Associated With Dam Safety Studies Required By The Mississippi Department Of Environmental Quality And Environmental Analysis And Preliminary Design Of A New Roadway To Remove Traffic From The Dam; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Pearl River County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repair And Renovation Of The Pearl River County Courthouse; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Ocean Springs, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Improvements To The City's Water System And Sewer System Infrastructure; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist Leake County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repair And Renovation Of The Leake County Courthouse; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Pontotoc, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With Repair, Maintenance And Other Improvements To The City's Sewer System And Related Infrastructure; To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With Construction Of The Chickasaw Heritage Center In Tupelo, Mississippi; To Amend Section 57-1-601, Mississippi Code Of 1972, Which Creates The Mississippi Main Street Investment Revolving Loan Fund And Provides For The Mississippi Development Authority To Establish A Program To Make Loans To Municipalities To Assist With Maintaining And Improving The Viability Of Revitalization Zones, To Revise The Purposes Of The Program; To Amend Section 71, Chapter 511, Laws Of 2016, To Revise The Purposes For Which The Proceeds Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Mississippi Science Exploration Center In Hattiesburg, Mississippi, May Be Utilized; To Extend The Period Of Time During Which Such Bonds May Be Issued; To Provide That The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Establish A Program To Make Funds Available For The Purpose Of Providing Funds To Assist In Paying Costs Associated With The Operation And Maintenance Of A National Park Or Other Federal Visitors Or Recreation Area When Due To A Shutdown Of The Federal Government, Federal Funds Are Unavailable And Have Been Unavailable For At Least Five Days For Such Purposes; To Provide That Upon A Determination By The Mississippi Development Authority That Due To A Shutdown Of The Federal Government, Federal Funds Are Unavailable And Have Been Unavailable For At Least Five Days For The Operation And Maintenance Of A National Park Or Other Federal Visitors Or Recreation Area Located In This State, The Mississippi Development Authority Shall Provide Notice Of Such Unavailability Of Funds To The Department Of Finance And Administration And Upon Receipt Of Such Notice, The Department, With The Concurrence Of The State Bond Commission, May Incur Debt, Including Notes Or Other Evidences Of Indebtedness, For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Special Fund Created To Provide Funds For Such Purposes; To Provide That The Maximum Amount Of Debt That May Be Outstanding For Such Purposes At Any Time Cannot Not Exceed $100,000.00; To Amend Section 27-104-301, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify Certain Provisions Relating To Disbursements From The 2018 Transportation And Infrastructure Improvements Fund For Projects In Attala County, Mississippi; To Clarify The Description Of The Authorized Repair And Renovation Of The Historic Rodney Presbyterian Church Project To Be Funded From Disbursements From The 2018 Transportation And Infrastructure Improvements Fund; To Clarify Certain Provisions Relating To Disbursements From The 2018 Transportation And Infrastructure Improvements Fund For Improvements To The Existing Rail Line And Related Facilities Running From The City Of Amory, Mississippi, To The City Of Fulton, Mississippi; To Clarify The Description Of Authorized Expenditures For The Amtrak Train Depot And Shelter In Marks, Mississippi; To Clarify The Description Of Authorized Expenditures In Summit For Lighting Installation And A Town Park; To Revise The Bridge Project In Hancock County, Mississippi, For Which Funds Are To Be Disbursed From The 2018 Transportation And Infrastructure Improvements Fund; And For Related Purposes.

3056.title: Bonds; authorize for improving entrances and paving parking lots for the Calhoun County Health Department buildings.
3056.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Board Of Supervisors Of Calhoun County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Improving Of Entrances And Paving Of Parking Lots For The Calhoun County Health Department Buildings Located On Mississippi Highway 9 In Pittsboro, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

3057.title: Bonds; authorize to assist Calhoun County to complete interior of expansion to Mississippi State Extension Multipurpose Building.
3057.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Board Of Supervisors Of Calhoun County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Completion Of The Interior Of The Expansion To The Mississippi State Extension Multipurpose Building, Located On Mississippi Highway 9 In Pittsboro, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

3058.title: Appropriation FY2020; DFA for second phase repair/renovation of GMBC Natchez project.
3058.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Finance And Administration For The Second Phase Of The Repair And Renovation Of The General Missionary Baptist State Convention Of Mississippi, Inc., Natchez Project, For Fiscal Year 2020.

3059.title: Appropriation FY2020; DFA for first phase planning/construction of City of Canton Municipal Complex.
3059.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Finance And Administration For The First Phase Of Planning And Construction Of The City Of Canton Municipal Complex, For Fiscal Year 2020; And For Related Purposes.

3060.title: Appropriation FY2020; DFA for City of Carthage Lincoln Park renovations.
3060.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Finance And Administration For The Planning/construction Of The Lincoln Park Renovation In Carthage, Mississippi, For Fiscal Year 2020.

3061.title: Appropriation FY2020; DFA for landmark church conversion into public library in Pickens, Mississippi.
3061.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Finance And Administration For The Repair, Renovation And Conversion Of A Landmark Church Into A Public Library In Pickens, Mississippi, For Fiscal Year 2020.

3062.title: City of Clarksdale; authorize the levying of special ad valorem tax to fund certain capital improvements.
3062.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Clarksdale, Mississippi, To Levy An Additional Ad Valorem Tax To Provide Funding For Certain Capital Improvements Within The City; To Require An Election Be Held On The Question Of The Imposition Of Such Additional Tax; And For Related Purposes.

3064.title: City of Pascagoula; reenact the hotel, motel and bed-and-breakfast tax, and extend the repeal date to July 1, 2023.
3064.description: An Act To Reenact And Amend Chapter 1005, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, As Last Amended By Chapter 912, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Provision Of Law Authorizing The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pascagoula, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Proceeds Derived From Hotel, Motel And Bed-and-breakfast Room Rentals In The City; And For Related Purposes.

3066.title: Bonds; authorize to assist Itawamba County in widening, upgrading and enhancing two bridges on Boat Ramp Road.
3066.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Board Of Supervisors Of Itawamba County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Widening, Upgrading And Enhancing Of Two Bridges On Boat Ramp Road; And For Related Purposes.

3067.title: Appropriation FY2020; DFA for repair and renovation of Northside Park in Kosciusko.
3067.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Finance And Administration For The Repair And Renovation Of Northside Park In Kosciusko, Attala County, Mississippi, For Fiscal Year 2020.

3068.title: Bonds; authorize issuance in amount of $3,000,000.00 for repair and renovation of Missionary Baptist Seminary in Natchez.
3068.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds For The Second-phase Repair And Renovation Of The Natchez Seminary Property Of The General Missionary Baptist State Convention Of Mississippi, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

3069.title: Bonds; authorize issuance in amount of $2,000,000.00 for planning and construction of City of Canton Municipal Complex.
3069.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Canton, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The First-phase Planning And Construction Of The City Of Canton Municipal Complex; And For Related Purposes.

3070.title: Bonds; authorize issuance in amount of $800,000.00 to assist City of Carthage in renovation of Lincoln Park.
3070.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Carthage, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Renovation Of Lincoln Park; And For Related Purposes.

3071.title: Bonds; authorize in amount of $1,000,000.00 to assist City of Pickens repair and renovate church for conversion into library.
3071.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Pickens, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair And Renovation Of Pickens Presbyterian Church On Mcmullen Street, For Its Conversion Into A Library; And For Related Purposes.

3072.title: Bonds; authorize issuance in amount of $500,000.00 to assist City of Kosciusko with repair and renovation of Northside Park.
3072.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Kosciusko, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Repair And Renovation Of Northside Park; And For Related Purposes.

3073.title: Bonds; authorize issuance in amount of $500,000.00 to assist City of Magee in improving city lagoon.
3073.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Magee, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Improvement Of Its City Lagoon; And For Related Purposes.

3075.title: Bonds; authorize issuance to assist City of Holly Springs with construction of a wellness and aquatics center.
3075.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The City Of Holly Springs, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A Wellness And Aquatics Center And Related Facilities; And For Related Purposes.

3076.title: City of Amory; reenact the hotel, motel and restaurant tax, and extend the repeal date to July 1, 2023.
3076.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 905, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, As Amended By Chapter 944, Local And Private Laws Of 2017, To Extend The Repeal Date On The Law That Authorizes The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Amory, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants And Utilize The Revenue From The Tax To Promote Tourism And Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

3079.title: Bonds; increase amount authorized for the Hinds County Development Project Loan Fund to allow use for construction of a parking garage.
3079.description: An Act To Amend Section 10, Chapter 567, Laws Of 2013, To Increase By $10,000,000.00 The Amount Of Bonds Authorized To Be Issued For The Hinds County Development Project Loan Fund And Authorize Money In The Fund To Be Utilized As A Loan To Hinds County, Mississippi, To Assist In Funding The Construction Of A Parking Garage Associated With A Certain Hotel Construction Project; And For Related Purposes.

3080.title: Sales tax; exempt sales of certain tangible personal property and services to Mississippi's Toughest Kids Foundation.
3080.description: An Act To Amend Section 27-65-111, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Exempt From Sales Taxation Sales Of Tangible Personal Property And Services To The Mississippi's Toughest Kids Foundation For Use Solely In The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of Buildings And Related Facilities And Infrastructure At Camp Kamassa In Copiah County, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

3082.title: Appropriation FY2020; DFA for emergency water main relocation along Highway 32 in the City of Charleston.
3082.description: An Act Making An Appropriation To The Mississippi Department Of Finance And Administration For The Emergency Water Main Relocation For The Asphalt Overlay Project Along Highway 32 In The City Of Charleston, Mississippi, For Fiscal Year 2020.

3083.title: Bonds; authorize for fire hydrants, enlargement of water service lines, and asphalt repair in Town of Summit.
3083.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Town Of Summit, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Purchase And Installation Of Fire Hydrants, The Enlargement Of Water Service Lines To Provide Sufficient Water Capacity For The Fire Hydrants, And The Repair Of Asphalt Paving On Streets Disrupted By The Enlarged Water Lines; And For Related Purposes.

3084.title: Bonds; authorize issuance in amount of $10,000,000.00 to fund economic development in Tunica County.
3084.description: An Act To Authorize The Issuance Of State General Obligation Bonds To Provide Funds To Assist The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, In Paying Costs Associated With The Promotion Of Economic Development In The County; And For Related Purposes.

3085.title: Tunica County; authorize to impose a license tax upon gaming devices.
3085.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Impose A License Tax Upon Gaming Devices Located On Vessels Which Dock In The County; And For Related Purposes.

3086.title: Tunica County; supervisors may authorize legal gaming in structures located, in whole or in part, on shore.
3086.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Permit Legal Gaming In Structures Located, In Whole Or In Part, On Shore In The County If The Structure Is Owned, Leased Or Controlled By A Person Possessing A Gaming License To Conduct Legal Gaming; And For Related Purposes.

3087.title: Issaquena County; authorize contracts with private entities for the management of county-owned regional jail facility.
3087.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Issaquena County, Mississippi, To Contract With A Private Entity For The Construction, Lease, Acquisition, Improvement, Operation Or Management Of A County-owned Jail Facility Being Used As A Regional Correctional Facility Housing Inmates For The Mississippi Department Of Corrections; To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors To Contract With The Mississippi Department Of Corrections, The United States Or Any State For The Housing Of Minimum Or Medium Security Offenders Who Are In The Custody Of Those Jurisdictions; And For Related Purposes.

3088.title: Tunica County; revise distribution of gaming revenue tax.
3088.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 866, Local And Private Laws Of 1992, As Last Amended By Chapter 920, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, To Revise The Distribution Of The Gaming Revenue Tax Imposed By The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Authorize Any Annual Surplus In The County General Road Fund To Be Loaned To The County General Fund, And To Require The Proceeds Of The Tax That Are Attributable To The Gross Gaming Revenue From A Sports Pool Or Race Book To Be Deposited Into A Special County Fund And Utilized Solely To Pay And/or Reduce Any Indebtedness Incurred With Regard To The Construction Of Public School Buildings In The County; And For Related Purposes.

3089.title: Coahoma County; authorize reserve and trust fund trustees to use certain amount to supplement county general fund.
3089.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 912, Local And Private Laws Of 2013, As Amended By Chapter 909, Local And Private Laws Of 2014, Which Establishes The Coahoma County Reserve And Trust Fund, To Authorize The Coahoma County Board Of Supervisors, Which Is The Trustee Of The Fund, To Utilize A Certain Amount Of The Fund To Supplement The County General Fund During Fiscal Year 2018-2019; To Provide That The Supplement Shall Be Repaid To The Fund Under Certain Circumstances; And For Related Purposes.

3090.title: Marshall County; authorize board of supervisors to contribute to Bishop Houck New Hope Village.
3090.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Bishop Houck New Hope Village; And For Related Purposes.

3091.title: Marshall County; authorize board of supervisors to contribute to ARISE2Read literacy program.
3091.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Marshall County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To The Arise2read Literacy Program; And For Related Purposes.

3094.title: City of Vicksburg; authorize to enter 20-year lease agreements for improvement of waterfront area park and amenities.
3094.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Vicksburg, Mississippi, To Enter Lease Agreements For A Period Of Up To 20 Years For The Purpose Of Improvements To The Waterfront Area Park And Related Amenities; To Apply Sections 31-8-5 Through 31-8-13, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Any Lease Agreement Entered Under This Act; And For Related Purposes.

3095.title: Tallahatchie County; authorize to offer Medicare-eligible employees supplemental compensation, insurance and/or benefits.
3095.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Tallahatchie County, Mississippi, To Offer Any Medicare-eligible County Employee Certain Benefits If The Employee Secures Medicare Coverage In Lieu Of Participating In Any County Medical Or Health Insurance Program; And For Related Purposes.

3096.title: DeSoto County; authorize to complete certain road projects that may extend beyond the term of the board of supervisors.
3096.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Desoto County, Mississippi, To Enter Into Contracts For Road Projects, As Defined Herein, That May Extend Beyond 30 Days From The Termination And End Of The Term Of Office Of Such Board; And For Related Purposes.

3097.title: City of Canton; allow 30-year agreement with MCEDA providing tax exemptions for certain property if annexed.
3097.description: An Act To Authorize The Mayor And Board Of Aldermen Of The City Of Canton, Mississippi, And The Members Of The Board Of Directors Of The Madison County Economic Development Authority To Enter Into Certain Agreements To Grant To Qualifying New Or Expanding Enterprises Legally Permitted Exemptions From, Or A Fee-in-lieu Of, City Ad Valorem Taxes With Respect To Certain Real Property Located Within Two Miles Of The Municipal Boundary Of The City, Together With Any Improvements And Personal Property Located Thereon, In Connection With The Development By The Madison County Economic Development Authority Of Such Real Property For Economic Development Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

3098.title: City of Greenville; authorize to impose special sales tax to fund certain capital improvements.
3098.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Greenville, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than One Percent On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The City Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of Seven Percent Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least Sixty Percent Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide That The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax Shall Be Used And Expended By The City For The Purpose Of Providing For The Payment Of The Principal Of And Interest On Bonds Issued By The City To Make Certain Capital Improvements.

3099.title: Warren County; authorize contributions for various organizations.
3099.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Central Mississippi Prevention Services, Inc.; Triumph Ministries, Inc.; Vicksburg Family Development Services, Inc.; Warren, Washington, Issaquena, Sharkey Community Action Agency, Inc.; Women's Restoration Shelter Of Mountain Faith Ministries; And We Care Communities, Inc.; And For Related Purposes.

3100.title: Warren County; authorize contracts with and contributions to local nonprofit economic development organizations.
3100.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Execute Contracts And Agreements With And Contribute Funds To, Local Nonprofit Economic Development Organizations; To Authorize Such Board To Provide Matching Funds Required By Any Program Or Grant Provided By The State Of Mississippi For Economic Development Purposes; And For Related Purposes.

3101.title: Warren County; authorize contributions to a local, nonprofit Veteran's Transition Center facility.
3101.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Warren County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To A Local, Nonprofit Veteran's Transition Center Facility To Aid And Assist Qualified Veterans In Financial Need; And For Related Purposes.

3102.title: City of Jackson; authorize additional tax on hotels and motels and extend repeal date on Convention and Visitors Bureau.
3102.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 909, Local And Private Laws Of 1999, As Last Amended By Chapter 954, Local And Private Laws Of 2018 To Extend Until July 1, 2022, The Repeal Date On The Provisions Of Law That Create The Jackson Convention And Visitors Bureau And Imposes A Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants, Hotels And Motels For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Bureau; To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Jackson, Mississippi, To Levy An Additional Tax On The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Hotels And Motels For The Purpose Of Providing Additional Funds For The Bureau; To Provide That The Levy Of The Additional Tax May Be Imposed Only If Approved At An Election By 60% Of Those Voting At The Election; And For Related Purposes.

3103.title: City of Indianola; authorize to impose special sales tax to fund certain infrastructure improvements.
3103.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Indianola, Mississippi, To Impose A Special Sales Tax Of Not More Than 1% On The Gross Proceeds Of All Sales Or The Gross Income Of Businesses In The City Derived From Activities Taxed At The Rate Of 7% Under The Mississippi Sales Tax Law; To Provide That The Special Sales Tax Shall Not Be Levied Unless Authorized By At Least 60% Of The Votes Cast At An Election Called And Held For Such Purpose; To Provide That The Revenue Collected From The Special Sales Tax Shall Be Used And Expended By The City For The Sole Purpose Of Funding The Repair And Replacement Of City Streets, Water Mains And Sewer Mains; And For Related Purposes.

3105.title: City of Moss Point; allow golf carts and low-speed vehicles on certain public roads.
3105.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Moss Point, Mississippi, To Allow The Operation Of Golf Carts And Low-speed Vehicles On Certain Public Roads And Streets Within The City Of Moss Point; To Require Individuals Operating A Golf Cart Or Low-speed Vehicle To Have A Valid Driver's License And Proof Of Insurance; To Require Golf Carts And Low-speed Vehicles To Be Registered With The City; To Authorize The City To Charge A Registration Fee; And For Related Purposes.

3106.title: Lafayette County; authorize board of supervisors to contribute to Interfaith Compassion Ministries.
3106.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Lafayette County, Mississippi, To Contribute Funds To Interfaith Compassion Ministries; And For Related Purposes.

3107.title: City of Gulfport; authorize tax on hotels, motels and restaurants for various purposes.
3107.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Gulfport, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room And Space Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Promotion Of Tourism, Economic Development, Infrastructure, And Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

3108.title: City of Columbia; authorize tax on hotels, motels and restaurants for tourism, parks and recreation.
3108.description: An Act To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Columbia, Mississippi, To Levy A Tax Upon The Gross Sales Of Hotels And Motels Derived From Room Rentals And Upon The Gross Proceeds Of Sales Of Restaurants For The Purpose Of Providing Funds For The Promotion Of Tourism And Parks And Recreation; And For Related Purposes.

3109.title: Tunica County; revise gaming tax revenue distribution-amount attributable to sports betting used to pay for school construction.
3109.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 866, Local And Private Laws Of 1992, As Last Amended By Chapter 920, Local And Private Laws Of 2004, To Revise The Distribution Of The Gaming Revenue Tax Imposed By The Board Of Supervisors Of Tunica County, Mississippi, To Require The Proceeds Of The Tax That Are Attributable To The Gross Gaming Revenue From A Sports Pool Or Race Book To Be Deposited Into A Special County Fund And Utilized Solely To Pay And/or Reduce Any Indebtedness Incurred With Regard To The Construction Of Public School Buildings In The County; And For Related Purposes.

3110.title: Board of Trustees of East MS Community College District; may enter into long-term lease of certain property it owns in Lowndes County.
3110.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of East Mississippi Community College To Enter Into Long-term Lease Agreements On Any Unimproved Real Property Located In Lowndes County, Mississippi, For The Purpose Of Facilitating The Construction Of A Facility That Will Complement The Public And Educational Purposes Of East Mississippi Community College; And For Related Purposes.

3111.title: Simpson County; economic development district may convey water tank, water system and easement to City of Mendenhall.
3111.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of The Simpson County Economic Development District To Convey The Water Tank And Related Water System Currently Existing In The Simpson County Commerce Park On Highway 43, Together With A Utility Easement Through The Park Property, To The City Of Mendenhall, Mississippi; And For Related Purposes.

3112.title: City of Pearl; expand the boundaries of the West Pearl Tax District.
3112.description: An Act To Amend Chapter 951, Local And Private Laws Of 2005, As Amended By Chapter 912, Local And Private Laws Of 2007, To Authorize The Governing Authorities Of The City Of Pearl, Mississippi, To Expand The Boundaries Of The West Pearl Restaurant Tax District; To Require An Election On The Question Of The Levying Of The Restaurant Tax Within The Expanded Boundaries Of The District; And For Related Purposes.

3113.title: Clay County; authorize to expend up to $50,000.00 to assist ICS (Head Start) with the purchase of a school bus.
3113.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Supervisors Of Clay County, Mississippi, To Expend Up To $50,000.00 To Assist The Institute Of Community Services, Also Known As Head Start, With The Purchase Of A School Bus; And For Related Purposes.

3114.title: Clay County; economic development district may sell certain land.
3114.description: An Act To Authorize The Board Of Trustees Of The Clay County Economic Development District To Sell Certain Real Property; And For Related Purposes.

Army Reserve Sergeant Randy Sandifer Of Pinola, Mississippi, Who Was Nominated For The 2014 Nobel Peace Prize For Environmental And Humanitarian Research While Stationed In The War Zone At The Abu Ghraib Facility In Iraq.
